metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12816 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Modules.cpp in ZNC before 1.7.4-rc1 allows remote authenticated non-admin users to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code by loading a module with a crafted name. It was discovered that ZNC incorrectly handled loading modules. A non-admin user could possibly use this to escalate privileges or execute arbitry code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12816` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

znc - 1.6.3-1ubuntu0.2
znc-perl - 1.6.3-1ubuntu0.2
znc-python - 1.6.3-1ubuntu0.2
znc-tcl - 1.6.3-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: znc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6.3-1ubuntu0.2').
